passage_text: Chewing gum may help ulcer relief. The bacteria which causes up to 90% of peptic ulcers may soon be eradicated by a type of naturally occurring chewing gum. Scientists have today announced details of a clinical trial on mastic gum, a natural tree resin, which grows in parts of Greece.

When it comes to acid reflux, chewing gum works to reduce acid in the esophagus. The act of chewing can increase your saliva production, and cause you to swallow more. This allows any acidity in your mouth to be cleared much more quickly. Gum chewing may provide even more relief if you chew bicarbonate gum.
